DataElement.preferredName: EORTC QLQ-BLM30 Version 1.0 36 Extent During Past Week Have Unintentional Release of Urine Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated perception during the past week of the extent to which they have experienced any unintentional release (leakage) of urine, using a four point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Bladder Cancer Muscle-Invasive 30 Questionnaire Extent During Past Week Have Urinary Incontinence Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A group with aims to conduct, develop, coordinate, and stimulate laboratory and clinical research in Europe to improve the management of cancer and related problems by increasing survival but also patients' quality of life. There are more than 60 institutions and departments that have been recognized by EORTC as affiliated. These groups conduct, on a voluntary basis, laboratory research and/or clinical trials on all types of cancers using a multidisciplinary approach. EORTC maintains close working relationship with NCI and the British Cancer Research United Kingdom in London._A questionnaire developed by the European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) consisting of 30 questions designed to assess quality of life in patients with muscle-invasive bladder cancer (BLM)._The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time._At some point in a given period of time._The most recent week, including today._A question about the extent to which an individual has or had unintentional release or leakage of urine._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Bladder Cancer Muscle-Invasive 30 Questionnaire
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A group with aims to conduct, develop, coordinate, and stimulate laboratory and clinical research in Europe to improve the management of cancer and related problems by increasing survival but also patients' quality of life. There are more than 60 institutions and departments that have been recognized by EORTC as affiliated. These groups conduct, on a voluntary basis, laboratory research and/or clinical trials on all types of cancers using a multidisciplinary approach. EORTC maintains close working relationship with NCI and the British Cancer Research United Kingdom in London.:A questionnaire developed by the European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) consisting of 30 questions designed to assess quality of life in patients with muscle-invasive bladder cancer (BLM).

Concepts.longName: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer
Concepts.definition: A group with aims to conduct, develop, coordinate, and stimulate laboratory and clinical research in Europe to improve the management of cancer and related problems by increasing survival but also patients' quality of life. There are more than 60 institutions and departments that have been recognized by EORTC as affiliated. These groups conduct, on a voluntary basis, laboratory research and/or clinical trials on all types of cancers using a multidisciplinary approach. EORTC maintains close working relationship with NCI and the British Cancer Research United Kingdom in London.

A questionnaire developed by the European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) consisting of 30 questions designed to assess quality of life in patients with muscle-invasive bladder cancer (BLM).

Property.preferredName: Extent During Past Week Have Urinary Incontinence Score
Property.preferredDefinition: The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.:At some point in a given period of time.:The most recent week, including today.:A question about the extent to which an individual has or had unintentional release or leakage of urine.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.
At some point in a given period of time.
The most recent week. May include the present day.
A question about the extent to which an individual has or had unintentional release or leakage of urine.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 1 (Not at All) to 4 (Very Much) on a Likert scale used on EORTC questionnaires.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Have you had any unintentiona
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have you had any unintentional release (leakage) of urine?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure.
